D83AB42E0A0D4FA6B6A7CC061032F812.description:
Explore the competitive events related to the content of this course and the required
competencies, skills, and knowledge for each related event for individual, team, and
chapter competitions.

AD6BDF0D899144E68A123E1F1C21807A.description:
Explain how participation in career and technology education student organizations can
promote lifelong responsibility for community service and professional development.

71B5D73E148A4D7BA2932F61FCE4C826.description:
Explore the local, state, and national opportunities available to students through
participation in related student organizations (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA) including but not
limited to conferences, competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other student
organization activities.

6D6DD51BCA88452BAC20CD9A7EAA0F39.description:
Explore the impact and opportunities a student organization (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA)
can develop to bring business and education together in a positive working relationship
through innovative leadership and career development programs.

F2C5E28D78514719A2AC45A0095B24A7.description:
Explain the goals, mission, and objectives of Future Business Leaders of America
(FBLA) and/or Technology Student Association (TSA) and/or SkillsUSA

C52D66637A28493A854EA09DDA59D890.description:
Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology
education courses through leadership development, school and community service
projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events

68C9A7E22C2B41CC9797D7D8E377C80C.description: Conduct a job search and share the appropriate folder with the potential employer.

21848EA9B3BA4D9EB0DFD46D0C597897.description:
Polish all entries in the online career portfolio to ensure accuracy and professionalism
as expected from employers.

7E28372C29534029AA92E3EFF939689F.description:
Identify and upload additional industry-appropriate artifacts reflective of mastered skills
throughout this course. Write and include a reflective entry for each artifact discussing
steps taken, problems encountered and how they were overcome, and other pertinent
information about the learning

2DBFC0A45BAF4C3A86B6AEE50010AA53.description: Update all current items in the portfolio

8454B74046E34EA0AA936F6E0171D24B.description:
2 Organize folders within the portfolio to reflect specific careers of interest, including
résumé, targeted cover letter, and artifacts relevant to the specific career.

54694DE4CC104845B0A78E92B67A65B6.description:
Review and update résumé to reflect new knowledge and skills master and additional
work experience.

AB717938F9B347C89BE83112AC46018C.description: Organize personal online career portfolio for specific career interests

B5655B438FFB4B568F2A61F2019F255B.description:
Demonstrate the knowledge and use of network statistics (netstat), a command
purpose.

AD01A07F30A54C25B90EB1E0771D883A.description: Locate open ports by completing a port scan.

B76AE435CD2641808BE9B29B2C0BECFE.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of network protocols (e.g., Transmission Control Protocol and
Internet Protocol (TCP/IP), Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) and directory
services (e.g., Domain Name System (DNS) by setting up common protocols, e.g.,
Secure Shell (SSH), netstat, Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP), nslookup, Telnet,
DNS/Bind, FTP, IIS/Web Pages, DHCP/DNS server. [NICE 81]

B65816EA3C334E528691290619E9F5DE.description: Configure a remote access policy Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) and Point-toPoint Tunneling Protocol (PPTP).

30207A39C5E24739851345AEC764A459.description: Spoof a Media Access Control (MAC) address.

230DFCCE4E274E21A8299736C5DDE4D8.description: Set up a Network Address Translation (NAT) device.

F031A24DA1E2459D8DA04EE966AF6431.description: Identify commonly used default network ports

A2ECA98260E44D6CABD1200F7AF36E6D.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of how network services and protocols interact to provide
network communications in order to securely implement and use common protocols.
[NICE 50]

F7A78FC845DC4C7CA64211F0D9D32183.description: Apply and implement secure network administration principles.

4E8095E7D0074BCEABD933B6CCA9646A.description: Demonstrate how to work with basic methods of network security

4C85C7FFA28540EE8A975173781D9EA3.description: Identify mitigations for risks from risk assessment.

396247B9D9A646DA83B89ACFC58F8A01.description:
Perform a risk assessment identifying the weak points of the average home router with
a handful of connected devices throughout the house.

384E2F3051074C0BA408B1DCE1576E1A.description:
Explain risk-related concepts, such as using public unsecured wi-fi, purchasing online,
transmitting person information online, and more.

6680514E42B84941B38A751F1BB3E5AC.description:
Implement risk management techniques for personal computer and network
systems.

95C59CBCA01447C7A586948B1A4F3636.description: Perform secure data destruction (e.g., Secure Erase, BCWipe).

AF7DF2A70A01472CB390BEC785CB4DFC.description:
View and modify an Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) table and understand the
business needs behind the tables.

277E1E9AB4EE4DAD841DE5F31FEF7399.description:
Demonstrate skill in conducting vulnerability scans and recognizing vulnerabilities in
security systems (e.g., Nessus, Nmap, Retina). [NICE 3]

85FF707FD76C4F9384710330272287BF.description:
Explain the proper use of penetration testing versus vulnerability scanning in the
context of vulnerability assessments.

954B0D13F8394225B1859B42457AEA9C.description:
Implement assessment tools and techniques to discover security threats and
vulnerabilities.

11B7881AB6434039B820DEC8FD310A14.description: Analyze and differentiate among types of mitigation and deterrent techniques.

5460D5A2DD60451285EAD99D7A398121.description: Perform security analysis, as well as testing and evaluation.

DA15C0702402471A925CB338EB421373.description: Restore a machine from a known good backup

FB2F229D76B445E0B9DB08558CABFE56.description:
Perform imaging functions, such as operating system, network, and software
configurations.

E31E89D1A18E4AD3957492FEDEED4FD6.description: Demonstrate the ability to capture volatile memory contents.

B841771E8A8C447CA44990F22185BC54.description: Explain how cloud backups in multiple locations helps mitigate disaster recovery

6BC1F9A776944D86BEFFA7197F347CDB.description: Execute disaster recovery plans and procedures

A8FAC9C577E947F5ABDF53870D2C2882.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of incident categories, incident responses, and timelines for
responses and compare-and-contrast aspects of business continuity. [NICE 60]

1FF1FF901C6F4E6C98D1D2AF3870EF4E.description: Demonstrate knowledge of incident response and handling methodologies. [NICE 61]

93BEBB03A2194FF1A630334574F393DB.description:
Implement contingency planning (incident response and disaster recovery)
techniques

245C6D0FE33746DB8C9666EE64951EB1.description: Write organizational security policies (email, wireless, etc.).

1D6153EB06CC4B388FDEC462BDD27B7A.description: Install environmental controls through Basic Input/Output System (BIOS).

A7D2ECF9B44A4B5EA5F16AD5DD872917.description: Explain the importance of security-related awareness and training

B5C2206DE50947738650185EC2D2B7CA.description:
Explain the impact and proper use of environmental controls, such as strong
passwords, locked server closets, using secured networks, and more.

DE5A232D10014E738214D89896918300.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of remote access policy Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP)
and Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP).

EB31372FAEA74D0FAC75F9EBC1290676.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of Virtual Private Network (VPN) security and configure Virtual
Private Network (VPN). [NICE 148]

F25BFE2AE19F4CA885E8FEA15CD18486.description: Change the power level of a Wireless Local Area Network (WLAN) Access Point

257D9E155A0342EB876D4750B5483036.description: Demonstrate use of InSSIDer and Netstumbler on wireless communications

C16706AA6BB2473288389A394F020297.description: Configure a wireless Access Point (WPA, WPA-2).

0FE648D96F9F4EBC94EF462E033EB937.description: Analyze and differentiate among types of wireless attacks.

F992A162D7384594B45F0445A1C3801B.description: Implement wireless networks in a secure manner

2B6BC60629164EA3B771A3C3898DBCBA.description: Apply advanced communications and wireless security techniques.

B89FFB5593A24319A0FE146887E668E3.description: Backup and restore a Certificate Authority (CA).

6FDB8D8E17C74C0CB25DE30075FC5DB2.description: Install and secure a Certificate Authority (CA).

169B42A70C9B45F49D32C681E6CB9D05.description: Renew, revoke, backup, and restore public and private key certificates

E121BBB198794E36925F512B4478486C.description: Understand and master process to enroll for digital certificates

BCA06C2913454E869FBBE2B0C519DE8F.description: Install and view a digital certificate.

90BE7D28F258406BB03CAD664D83B8DE.description: Install and configure Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) and send/receive PGP encrypted email.

F380ABE6A2B447C9AE4C090A87B1EC2C.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of network access, identity, and access management (e.g.,
public key infrastructure [PKI]) and implement PKI, certificate management, and
associated components. [NICE 79].

3F530548429C44548AFEF55D0FA534EB.description: Explain the core concepts of Public Key Infrastructure.

4DCC9D352E4D49CBBAAC45AD62FE9E94.description: Use and apply appropriate cryptographic tools and products.

1CD11690B7244D5E913A601BC65AFEA7.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of DoS/DDoS, session hijacking, HTTP spoofing, DNS
attacks, switch attacks, man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks, and cross site scripting, and
drive-by-attacks.

62D58A0D143F476A87AB5E8EDCCEED0D.description:
Distinguish between reconnaissance/footprinting, infiltration, network breach, network
exploitation, and attack for effects (e.g., deceive, disrupt, degrade, and destroy).

C3A7B32605C648219E9946F661913EB0.description:
Distinguish between different social engineering attacks (e.g., baiting, phishing/spear
phishing, pretexting/ blagging, tailgating, quid pro quo, etc.).

BA3AFF026D2846A1B3B23A5E641980F0.description:
Analyze and differentiate among types of network attacks (e.g., virus, worms, trojans,
unpatched software, password cracking, advanced persistent threats, etc.).

59B52034875542BFBEC54C998265DEBC.description: Demonstrate how to analyze and react to various threats and vulnerabilities.

B91FE480FC26492FB54F7D67409D8929.description:
Demonstrate skill in preserving evidence integrity according to standard operating
procedures or national standards. [NICE 217].

565081D178ED4414B97FF6DF566A014B.description: Demonstrate skill in handling malicious software. [NICE 153]

9506326599B44AE58F6ABDBF4BBF8287.description: Identify malicious software code, including strings and SQL injection

CCBFAB666DA447EEBEABE5239F2676AE.description:
Analyze and differentiate among types of malicious software, such as malware,
ransomware, and others.

D6FB719DB96F488291F0FBFC7758EDF1.description: Investigate concepts of malicious software threats.

F33F264914C54B3D93B1B069CEFD852D.description:
Research and discuss legislation, such as GDPR, COPPA, FERPA, and others, that
protects the rights and data of individuals online, including social media sites

13DCF8384BF44A6E8D86EF1C943F016A.description: Discuss the importance of cyber safety and the impact of cyber bullying.

BD14C02F28304C7CB06A29A63694D171.description:
Explain proper netiquette, including the use of e-mail, social networking, blogs, texting,
and chatting.
a. Discuss who legally owns content on free online services (Gmail, FaceBook, etc.)

08C389D344D840E0B62D913C01F21C61.description:
Identify netiquette including the use of e-mail, social networking, blogs, texting, and
chatting.

33E3F120F59F45C2AF4D3A0D9CF12BFB.description:
Discuss computer crimes, terms of use, and legal issues such as copyright laws, fair
use laws, and ethics pertaining to scanned and downloaded clip art images,
photographs, documents, video, recorded sounds and music, trademarks, and other
elements for use in Web publications.

51FA736097884F629BF6A403986AA10B.description:
Differentiate between freeware, shareware, and public domain software copyrights.
Determine which industries use open versus proprietary in operating systems.

C76A861ECF88455183004E68EA3AD945.description:
Explain the consequences of illegal, social, and unethical uses of information
technologies (e.g., piracy; illegal downloading; licensing infringement; inappropriate
uses of software, hardware, and mobile devices).

354AF678EB714D0BB45944458EE1AC52.description: Investigate potential abuse and unethical uses of computers and networks.

EFE25A7C3D744EDEA2AF83B00A55BF42.description:
Describe internal and external threats to a computer network, methods of avoiding
attacks (including patching), and options in dealing with virus attacks.

044A85DF78704E82A29F073232718088.description: Explore concepts of cybersecurity related to legal and ethical decisions.

5361CE7EE2B8413390E42820DFEBADCD.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior, and language.

9C1CB73E8C1C48EBB1F1644AD36EA871.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to
be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills

5D9A4C50E6004B36B5971CD6A6A37597.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

17DAA0C1B1814D249F16433E17CBBE2C.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem-solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

E7A4EED0A87748C190261B9DEB860E25.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

F1C4C99736734458AB45671D9E34C682.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

E5CC3A9696CB40A5A1106CB035595214.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
